現実〈リアル〉もたまには嘘をつく
Sometimes Even Reality Is a Lie!

title: Real mo Tama ni wa Uso wo Tsuku
title_english: Sometimes Even Reality Is a Lie!
title_japanese: 現実〈リアル〉もたまには嘘をつく
title_synonyms: Genjitsu mo Tama ni wa Uso wo Tsuku
Game-zuki no Tomodachi to Iroiro suru Hanashi
Hanging Out with a Gamer Girl
synopsis:
Kaoru Terazaki is a young boy who uses a female character in an online game. He usually plays with a virtual friend who goes by the username Nanami and uses a male avatar. Kaoru has been lying about his identity, and the two will soon meet in real life for the first time. When the day finally arrives, they realize that their expectations are quite different from reality.

Contrary to Kaoru's expectations, Nanami turns out to be a girl. With their genders revealed, they are both in shock—especially Nanami. She has already told her enthusiastic mother and overprotective father about her female friend coming to their house. Consequently, Nanami comes up with an idea to mask Kaoru's true gender: crossdressing! Even though their friendship started with lies, this odd meetup marks the beginning of their unusual bond.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
background: Real mo Tama ni wa Uso wo Tsuku, also released under the title Game-zuki no Tomodachi to Iroiro suru Hanashi (ゲーム好きの友達と色々する話), is a web manga released on the author's Twitter and pixiv accounts since August 5, 2018, and published in print by Kadokawa since July 31, 2020. It has been published as doujinshi since August 12, 2018, when the first volume was released at Comic Market 94. The series has been published digitally in English as Sometimes Even Reality Is a Lie! by J-Novel Club since June 22, 2022.
